conclusion: Identify shadows A, B, C, and D from the image and analyze changes when the light source moves.
The image shows three objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D. Visible objects include a cat figurine, corkboard with sticky notes, and a postcard on a toilet-shaped stand.
Shadows are cast from a light source in the foreground.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the right and become longer due to increased distance from the light source.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will move in that direction, becoming shorter and less distinct.
Shadow size changes are due to the inverse square law, where shadow size increases with distance from the light source.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the right and become longer and bigger.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will move to the left and become shorter and smaller.
Change in shadow size and position is due to the inverse square law, where light intensity decreases with the square of the distance from the light source.
